text:
assage 
your breasts and express 
your milk (see page 126 for 
more information on how to 
do this).
• Applying warmth to your 
breast, for example using a 
warm	flannel	before	a	feed,	
can	help	milk	flow	and	make	
you feel more comfortable.
• While your baby is feeding, 
gently stroke the lumpy 
area	with	your	fingertips	
towards your nipple. This 
should	help	the	milk	to	flow.
• Apply a cold compress 
after feeding.
• Get lots of rest. Go to bed 
and catch up on your sleep 
whenever you can.
•
